comment.author: 63506476@N04
comment._content: Evangeline “Eva” Booth was born in London, England, to the Booth family that founded the Salvation Army. Eva Booth worked in her father's army for several years in England before he asked her to go to the United States. Eva became an American citizen in 1923, her work was known throughout the International Salvation Army, which had spread to all corners of the world. www.nwhm.org/education-resources/biography/biographies/ev...
